Class: ExceptionHandler

Overview

ExceptionHandler handle error in a clean way

Author:

  • Jessym Reziga jessym@konsserto.com

Class Method Details

. (void) handle(exception, response, engine, status = 500, quiet = false, charset = 'utf-8')

Handle the exception thrown

Parameters:

  • exception ( Object ) — The exception thrown
  • response ( Object ) — The response object concerned
  • engine ( Object ) — The template engine of the application
  • status ( Number ) — The HTML Error code, default is 500
  • quiet ( Bollean ) — Should the excpetion be quiet ?
  • charset ( String ) — Charset concerned, default is utf-8

. (Object) getContent()

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — The reponse with the parameters and the message to display on the screen

. (Object) parse(errors)

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — The error parsed with the good format to be managed by Konsserto

. (Object) getSourceCode(needle, offset, array)

Returns:

  • ( Object ) — The source code concerned by the error stack

. (void) setCharset(charset)

Parameters:

  • charset ( String ) — The charset of the error

. (String) getCharset()

Returns:

  • ( String ) — The charset of the error
